    "question": "How are total energy losses in a transformer calculated?",

    "instruction": "Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the describe the calculation of the temperature correction factor.",
    "question": "How is the temperature correction factor at time t calculated?",

    "context": "Ratio of winding electrical resistance is calculated using winding and ambient temperatures.; From EnergyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: On-Site Generation Power Conversion and Storage -> Section: Electric Load Center Distribution Manager ->  text.",
    "instruction": "Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the explain how to calculate the ratio of winding electrical resistance.",
    "question": "How is the ratio of winding electrical resistance calculated?",
    "answer": "The ratio of winding electrical resistance is calculated as: R(t)/R_ref = (F + T_winding(t) + T_amb(t)) / (F + T_windingref + T_ambref)"

    "question": "How is the part-load ratio calculated?",
    "answer": "IF ( P_ElecFull~Load > 0 ) THEN PLR = P_ElecOperating / P_ElecFull~Load PLR = MIN( PLR PLR_max ) PLR = MAX( PLR PLR_min ) ELSE PLR = 0 END IF"

ElecEfficiencyFPLR is the user-defined Electrical Efficiency Modifier Curve (function of part-load ratio) evaluated at the current operating part-load ratio. ElecEff_Operating is the electrical efficiency at the current operating conditions. ElecEff_RefLHV is the reference electrical efficiency (LHV [lower heating value] Basis) user input."

    "question": "How is the rated power output (\\(P_W\\)) defined?",
    "answer": "The rated power output is defined as the power output at the rated wind speed if either the power production or local wind speed is greater than the rated power."

    "instruction": "Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the list the variables and their descriptions used in the wind turbine model.",
    "question": "What are the variables and their descriptions in the wind turbine model?",
    "answer": "Refer to the table for variables and descriptions: A\\(_R\\) - swept area of rotor (m\\(^2\\)) A\\(_C\\) - blade chord area (m\\(^2\\)) a - site wind exponent (0.22) a\\(_met\\) - wind exponent (0.14) C\\(_d\\) - blade drag coefficient (0.9) C\\(_l\\) - blade lift coefficients (0.05) C\\(_n\\) - normal force coefficient C\\(_p\\) - power coefficient C\\(_t\\) - tangential force coefficient C\\(_1-6\\) - empirical power coefficient parameters g\\(_o\\) - standard gravity (m/s\\(^2\\)) F\\(_n\\) - normal force in radial direction (N-m) F\\(_t\\) - tangential force (N-m) F\\(_ta\\) - average tangential force (N-m) F\\(_v\\) - wind speed factor H - height of local wind speed measurement (m) H\\(_met\\) - height of turbine (10 m) N - number of blades P - overall power production (W) P\\(_Local\\) - outdoor static air pressure (Pa) P\\(_W\\) - wind turbine power produced (W) Q - overall torque (N-m) R - turbine radius (m) T\\(_Local\\) - local air temperature (°C) v - ambient wind speed (m/s) v\\(_1\\) - upstream wind speed (m/s) v\\(_2\\) - wind speed on the turbine (m/s) v\\(_3\\) - downstream wake velocity (m/s) V\\(_a\\) - induced velocity (m/s) V\\(_AnnualAvg\\) - annual average wind speed (m/s) V\\(_Local\\) - local wind speed (m/s) V\\(_LocalTMY\\) - annual average wind speed at local station height (m/s) V\\(_c\\) - chordal velocity component (m/s) V\\(_n\\) - normal velocity component (m/s) V\\(_Z\\) - wind speed adjusted at rotor height (m/s) W - relative flow velocity (m/s) Z - height of wind turbine rotor (m) \\(\\alpha\\) - blade angle of attack (deg) \\(\\theta\\) - azimuth angle (deg) \\(\\rho\\)\\(_Local\\) - local density of air (kg/m\\(^3\\)) \\(\\omega\\) - angular velocity of turbine (rad/s) \\(\\omega\\)\\(_Local\\) - local humidity ratio (kg-H\\(_2\\)O/kg-air) x - exponent (1.5) \\(\\lambda\\) - tip speed ratio \\(\\lambda\\)\\(_i\\) - tip speed ratio at the i\\(^th\\) pitch \\(\\delta\\)\\(_met\\) - wind boundary layer thickness (270 m)."

    "question": "What are the mechanisms considered for modeling capacity degradation?",
    "answer": "The mechanisms are 1) the loss of cyclable Lithium due to formation of solid electrolyte interface (SEI) and 2) the mechanical damage of the negative electrode due to charge/discharge cycles."

    "context": "Total energy losses in a transformer are calculated using no load and load losses.; From EnergyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: On-Site Generation Power Conversion and Storage -> Section: Electric Load Center Distribution Manager ->  text.",
    "instruction": "Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the provide the formula for calculating total energy losses in transformers.",
    "question": "How are total energy losses in a transformer calculated?",
    "answer": "The total energy losses in a transformer at time t is calculated as: TL(t) = NL + LL(t) = NL + LL*P(t)^2*f_T(t)"

    "answer": "The per unit load at time t is calculated as: P(t) = Load(t) / S_B"

 {
    "context": "Temperature correction factor at time t is calculated using winding resistance ratios.; From EnergyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: On-Site Generation Power Conversion and Storage -> Section: Electric Load Center Distribution Manager ->  text.",
    "instruction": "Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the describe the calculation of the temperature correction factor.",
    "question": "How is the temperature correction factor at time t calculated?",
    "answer": "The temperature correction factor at time t is calculated as: f_T(t) = L_dc*(R(t)/R_ref) + L_eddy*(R_ref/R(t))"

    "answer": "ElecEfficiencyFTemp is the user-defined Electrical Efficiency Modifier Curve (function of temperature) evaluated at the current combustion air inlet temperature. ElecEff_Operating is the electrical efficiency at the current operating conditions. ElecEff_RefLHV is the reference electrical efficiency (LHV [lower heating value] Basis) user input."

    "question": "What determines the value of the fuel mass flow rate at time t+Δt?",
    "answer": "The fuel mass flow rate at time t+Δt is determined by whether the rate of change of fuel mass flow is less than or equal to the maximum rate of change.     "instruction": "Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the list the variables and their descriptions used in the wind turbine model.",
    "question": "What are the variables and their descriptions in the wind turbine model?",
    "answer": "Refer to the table for variables and descriptions: A\\(_R\\) - swept area of rotor (m\\(^2\\)) A\\(_C\\) - blade chord area (m\\(^2\\)) a - site wind exponent (0.22) a\\(_met\\) - wind exponent (0.14) C\\(_d\\) - blade drag coefficient (0.9) C\\(_l\\) - blade lift coefficients (0.05) C\\(_n\\) - normal force coefficient C\\(_p\\) - power coefficient C\\(_t\\) - tangential force coefficient C\\(_1-6\\) - empirical power coefficient parameters g\\(_o\\) - standard gravity (m/s\\(^2\\)) F\\(_n\\) - normal force in radial direction (N-m) F\\(_t\\) - tangential force (N-m) F\\(_ta\\) - average tangential force (N-m) F\\(_v\\) - wind speed factor H - height of local wind speed measurement (m) H\\(_met\\) - height of turbine (10 m) N - number of blades P - overall power production (W) P\\(_Local\\) - outdoor static air pressure (Pa) P\\(_W\\) - wind turbine power produced (W) Q - overall torque (N-m) R - turbine radius (m) T\\(_Local\\) - local air temperature (°C) v - ambient wind speed (m/s) v\\(_1\\) - upstream wind speed (m/s) v\\(_2\\) - wind speed on the turbine (m/s) v\\(_3\\) - downstream wake velocity (m/s) V\\(_a\\) - induced velocity (m/s) V\\(_AnnualAvg\\) - annual average wind speed (m/s) V\\(_Local\\) - local wind speed (m/s) V\\(_LocalTMY\\) - annual average wind speed at local station height (m/s) V\\(_c\\) - chordal velocity component (m/s) V\\(_n\\) - normal velocity component (m/s) V\\(_Z\\) - wind speed adjusted at rotor height (m/s) W - relative flow velocity (m/s) Z - height of wind turbine rotor (m) \\(\\alpha\\) - blade angle of attack (deg) \\(\\theta\\) - azimuth angle (deg) \\(\\rho\\)\\(_Local\\) - local density of air (kg/m\\(^3\\)) \\(\\omega\\) - angular velocity of turbine (rad/s) \\(\\omega\\)\\(_Local\\) - local humidity ratio (kg-H\\(_2\\)O/kg-air) x - exponent (1.5) \\(\\lambda\\) - tip speed ratio \\(\\lambda\\)\\(_i\\) - tip speed ratio at the i\\(^th\\) pitch \\(\\delta\\)\\(_met\\) - wind boundary layer thickness (270 m)."
